intro: Sisymbrium molle, commonly known as woolly brookweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Sisymbrium molle is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to thrive in wet environments.
